content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I attempted to use the "get_hyperlinks" command to gather information from a ScienceDirect page on river restoration techniques, but received an HTTP 403 error. I then used the "browse_website" command to gather information on the same topic, which discussed the evolution, challenges, and limitations of river restoration techniques in Europe. I saved this information to a file called "river_restoration_techniques.txt" using the "write_to_file" command and read it back using the "read_file" command. I also used the "google" command to find additional resources on river restoration techniques. Upon attempting to use "get_hyperlinks" again, I received another HTTP 403 error. I then used the "browse_website" command to gather information from the River Restoration Centre website, which provided detailed examples of innovative and best-practice river restoration techniques, including 68 case examples from 39 sites across the UK. Techniques mentioned on the website include restoring meanders to straightened rivers, improving channel morphology, removing or bypassing barriers, and green bank protection. I saved this information to the same file "river_restoration_techniques.txt" using the "write_to_file" command and read it back using the "read_file" command.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "get_hyperlinks", "args": {"url": "https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/earth-and-planetary-sciences/river-restoration"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command get_hyperlinks returned: Error: HTTP 403 error', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "river restoration techniques"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://www.engr.colostate.edu/~bbledsoe/CIVE413/Manual_of_River_Restoration_Techniques.htm", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stream_restoration", "https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/earth-and-planetary-sciences/river-restoration", "http://nwrm.eu/source/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://academic.oup.com/bioscience/article/60/3/209/257006", "https://www.gov.uk/flood-and-coastal-erosion-risk-management-research-reports/updating-the-river-restoration-centre-manual-of-restoration-techniques", "https://www.iowadnr.gov/Portals/idnr/uploads/RiverRestoration/toolbox/vegetative-restoration/Practice%202_Vegetative_Restoration_Full_Chapter.pdf"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "question": "What are some of the river restoration techniques mentioned on this website?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: a website for the River Restoration Centre (RRC), which provides information on river restoration techniques. The RRC Manual of River Restoration Techniques offers detailed examples of innovative and best-practice river restoration techniques, including 68 case examples from 39 sites across the UK. The website also offers decision support pages to help identify relevant case studies and further advice on techniques. Techniques mentioned on the website include restoring meanders to straightened rivers, improving channel morphology, removing or bypassing barriers, and green bank protection.\n\nLinks: ['Skip to main content (https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques#main-content)', ' (https://www.therrc.co.uk/)', 'Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/theriverrestorationcentre)', 'Linkedin (http://www.linkedin.com/company/uk-river-restoration-centre-rrc-)', 'Twitter (http://twitter.com/The_RRC)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "read_file", "args": {"filename": "river_restoration_techniques.txt"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command read_file returned: discussing the evolution, challenges, and limitations of river restoration techniques in Europe, with a focus on maintaining ecological balance, increasing biodiversity, and improving water quality. The importance of considering natural processes and dynamic flow regimes is emphasized, and successful case studies are presented. The text also suggests a shift towards larger-scale projects and a focus on hyporheic processes, riparian zones, floodplains, and backwaters, and emphasizes the need for interdisciplinary approaches and post-project evaluation and monitoring. The greatest threats to progress are human population growth and climate change.', type='action_result')]
"""
